chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONCURRENT to any other sentence.
Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court waived all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court for Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law. Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 1 AND 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, she may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 42 days time served. 

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample. Court waived all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) due to a finding of indigency. 

20 day appeal rights given.
1365  WIS JI - Criminal
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Sentencing Memo
Defendant's Ineligible Voting Rights form
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Received and Filed:  Defense's Letter to the Court regarding prompt disposition.

Received and Filed:  Request for Prompt Disposition. 
Expires 12-20-2022.

Defense requests that the defendant appear via Zoom for the plea/sentencing date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Plea/sentencing remains scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright not in court, in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in court by video with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons who appears in person.  Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greendale Officer R. Zainer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Melissa Fitzsimmons, filed.

Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Macy's Department Store  Southridge Mall 5400 S. 76th St. Greendale, WI.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ariana Nichell Watson-Wright appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
